summary: Add an experimental `StartDelay` option to `StartWorkflowOptions` that causes Temporal to wait before dispatching the first workflow task. If the workflow receives a signal before the delay expires, the task is dispatched and the remaining delay is ignored.
userImpact: Allows users to control when workflow execution begins, enabling delayed start scenarios and better signal handling.
proposedFix: Implement `StartDelay` option in `StartWorkflowOptions` with logic to cancel remaining delay if signal is received before timeout.
resolutionDetails: Feature implemented and merged into the PHP SDK, aligned with Go SDK v1.25.0 implementation.
keyQuote: StartDelay will cause Temporal to wait before dispatching the first workflow task. If the workflow gets a signal before the delay, a workflow task will be dispatched and the rest of the delay will be ignored.
